Title: Naming What's Not Working
Overall Purpose: To create a space where challenges and inefficiencies can be openly identified and addressed, fostering a culture of transparency and continuous improvement.
Why This Matters: Without naming what isn't working, problems persist and compound, leading to inefficiencies, frustration, and missed opportunities for growth and innovation.
When To Use This Protocol: Use when recurring issues arise, during team reflections, or when progress feels stalled despite efforts.

Overall Outcomes.Poor: You avoid addressing issues and let them fester → The future is burdened with unresolved problems and declining morale.
Overall Outcomes.Expected: You identify some issues but overlook others → The future experiences sporadic improvements but persistent underlying problems.
Overall Outcomes.Excellent: You consistently name and address issues openly → The future benefits from steady growth and enhanced team dynamics.
Overall Outcomes.Transcendent: Naming issues becomes a natural and integral part of the culture → The future thrives on adaptability and proactive problem-solving.

Themes.Name: Creating a Safe Environment
Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To ensure team members feel safe to speak up about issues without fear of retribution.
Themes.Why This Matters: A safe environment encourages honesty and openness, which are essential for identifying and resolving problems.

Poor.Present pattern: Team members are hesitant to speak up.
Poor.Future effect: The future inherits a culture of silence and stagnation.

Expected.Present pattern: Some team members feel safe to share issues.
Expected.Future effect: The future sees sporadic improvements but lingering issues.

Excellent.Present pattern: Team members feel consistently safe to share issues.
Excellent.Future effect: The future benefits from continuous improvement and trust.

Transcendent.Present pattern: Safety to speak up is ingrained in the culture.
Transcendent.Example moves: Embedding feedback mechanisms into daily operations.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future thrives on a culture of openness and resilience.

Guiding Questions: Do team members feel safe to share concerns?
What barriers exist to open communication?
How can we reinforce a culture of safety?

Themes.Name: Identifying Core Issues
Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To discern the root causes of problems rather than just symptoms.
Themes.Why This Matters: Addressing symptoms without understanding root causes leads to temporary fixes and recurring issues.

Poor.Present pattern: Focus is on symptoms, not causes.
Poor.Future effect: The future is trapped in a loop of unresolved issues.

Expected.Present pattern: Some root causes are identified, others missed.
Expected.Future effect: The future experiences partial relief but ongoing challenges.

Excellent.Present pattern: Root causes are consistently identified and addressed.
Excellent.Edge condition: Balancing depth of analysis with action.
Excellent.Future effect: The future enjoys sustained growth and problem resolution.

Transcendent.Present pattern: Root cause analysis is a habitual practice.
Transcendent.Example moves: Integrating root cause analysis into all processes.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future thrives on a foundation of understanding and foresight.

Guiding Questions: What are the underlying causes of these issues?
How can we differentiate symptoms from causes?
What tools can help us uncover root causes?

Themes.Name: Encouraging Constructive Dialogue
Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To foster discussions that are solution-oriented and respectful.
Themes.Why This Matters: Constructive dialogue leads to effective problem-solving and strengthens team cohesion.

Poor.Future effect: The future is marked by division and inefficiency.

Expected.Present pattern: Some discussions are constructive, others not.
Expected.Future effect: The future sees sporadic collaboration and problem-solving.

Excellent.Present pattern: Discussions are consistently constructive and solution-focused.
Excellent.30-90 day system effect: Strong team cohesion and problem resolution.
Excellent.Future effect: The future benefits from a culture of collaboration and innovation.

Transcendent.Present pattern: Constructive dialogue is a cultural norm.
Transcendent.Example moves: Embedding dialogue principles into team culture.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future thrives on creativity and collective intelligence.

Guiding Questions: How can we ensure our discussions remain constructive?
How do we handle disagreements productively?

Themes.Name: Building a Feedback Loop
Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To create mechanisms for continuous feedback and improvement.
Themes.Why This Matters: A feedback loop ensures that issues are continuously identified and addressed, preventing stagnation.

Poor.Future effect: The future is marked by unaddressed challenges.

Expected.Present pattern: Feedback occurs occasionally but lacks structure.
Expected.Signals: Feedback is uneven, some issues addressed.
Expected.Future effect: The future experiences partial progress but ongoing issues.

Excellent.Future effect: The future thrives on continuous learning and improvement.

Transcendent.Present pattern: Feedback loops are embedded in the culture.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future is characterized by agility and sustained growth.

Guiding Questions: How can we create effective feedback mechanisms?
How do we ensure feedback leads to action?

Themes.Name: Celebrating Progress and Learning
Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To acknowledge improvements and learnings, reinforcing positive behaviors.
Themes.Why This Matters: Celebrating progress motivates teams and reinforces a culture of improvement and learning.

Poor.Future effect: The future is marked by disengagement and stagnation.

Expected.Present pattern: Some progress is acknowledged, some is not.
Expected.Future effect: The future experiences fluctuating motivation and progress.

Excellent.Present pattern: Progress and learning are consistently celebrated.
Excellent.Future effect: The future thrives on a culture of motivation and continuous improvement.

Transcendent.Present pattern: Celebration of progress is cultural and ongoing.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future is characterized by a vibrant, motivated, and innovative culture.

Guiding Questions: How can we celebrate progress effectively?
What practices reinforce learning and improvement?
How do we ensure recognition is meaningful?

Completion Prompts: Identify one issue you can address openly this week.
Choose one area to implement a feedback loop.
Reflect on recent progress: How can you celebrate it with your team?
